page.title: 14LANGUAGE
page.content: During recent years the local colour of the language of this block has faded, being almost entirely replaced by BBc English with a Suffolk accent. Some dialect words & phrases, however do survive and are used quite naturally in everyday speech. It is difficult to establish whether some of these are confined purely to any given area, but many are not well understood in other counties. CHANCE TIME -occasionally DWILE - floorcloth DUZZY - adj: damned FARE -v; to seem, to feel HARNSER - heron HINDER - yonder PUTTER - to grumble or mutter RANY - a shrew SQUIT- spoken nonsense SKEW - out of line, crooked
